title: Video appears to show Ukraine drone attack in Russia
summary: Ukraine claims to have hit more than 40 Russian bomber planes at a number of military airbases . Footage appears to show Russian warplanes on a runway being struck and bursting into flames .

title: 31 killed after Israeli forces attack near Gaza aid centre, Hamas-run health authorities say
summary: 31 killed in Israeli gunfire near Gaza aid centre, Hamas-run health authorities say . Reports said one incident occurred as people were queueing for aid in Rafah . Another incident said to have happened near a separate aid centre in central Gaza .

title: Two dead and hundreds arrested in France after PSG Champions League win
summary: Two dead and hundreds arrested in France after PSG Champions League win . Flares and fireworks set off, bus shelters smashed and cars torched amid wild celebrations . PSG's Champions League trophy parade will go ahead on Sunday evening .

title: Women and girls ‘not safe anywhere’ as Darfur suffers surge in sexual violence
summary: Médecins Sans Frontières treated 659 sexual violence survivors in South Darfur region alone . More than two-thirds of those treated treated had been raped, charity says . 27-year-old nurse said she was raped last year by fighters who accused her of treating Sudanese army soldiers .

title: At least 115 killed in floods in central Nigeria
summary: The town of Mokwa was submerged after torrential rains began on Wednesday night and continued into Thursday morning . More than 3,000 houses have been submerged, local authorities said on Friday . Heavy storms forecast for Abuja and 14 of the country’s 36 states including Niger .

title: Mother of jailed British-Egyptian activist hospitalised after 242 days on hunger strike
summary: Laila Soueif has been on hunger strike for 242 days in protest against the imprisonment of her son . Alaa Abd el-Fattah has been in jail in Egypt since September 2019 . His mother has not eaten any food since 29 September 2024 .

title: Aid ship aiming to break Israel’s siege of Gaza sets sail from Italy
summary: The 12-person crew, which includes climate activist Greta Thunberg, expects to take seven days to reach Gaza . The voyage comes after another vessel operated by the Freedom Flotilla Coalition was hit by two drones in May . The FCC, launched in 2010, is a non-violent international protest against the blockade on Gaza .

title: Does damning IAEA report mark end of an Iran nuclear deal?
summary: U.S. says it is in Iran's best interests to accept a deal with the West . Tehran says it will take 'appropriate countermeasures' if the deal is struck . U.N. nuclear watchdog says it has 'no obligation' to work with Iran .

title: Is the US losing its place as the world leader in science?
summary: Holden Thorp is the editor of Science journal and former chancellor of the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill . He says the US is slowly losing its position as the world leader in research and development . Thorp predicts the results will be “bad for science in general, and also for the US role in innovation”

title: Russian military strikes Ukrainian drone launch site (VIDEO)
summary: Russian Defense Ministry says 30 long-range UAVs were used in the strike . The strikes were part of a major operation called ‘Spiderweb’ that had been prepared for more than a year . Drone attacks reported in Russia's Siberian Irkutsk Region .

title: ‘Brussels hijacked our future’ – Orban
summary: Hungarian PM Orban says Brussels has "hijacked its future" by eroding public safety . Orban's plan is based on what he calls four pillars: a path toward peace on the continent and defusing tensions . Prime Minister Orban says the EU should not accept Ukraine as a member of the bloc .

title: Ukraine conflict a NATO ‘proxy war’ - Trump envoy
summary: Keith Kellogg has echoed Moscow’s characterization of the hostilities against Russia . Kellogg referred to comments by German Chancellor Friedrich Merz, who last month indicated that Berlin would be open to supplying Kiev with Taurus cruise missiles . Putin has made it clear: if such weapons are supplied to Ukraine, Russia will regard the suppliers as a party to the conflict .

title: Russia’s position on Ukraine to be presented in detail on Monday — chief negotiator
summary: Russia's chief negotiator Vladimir Medinsky has said that Russia’s position on the Ukrainian settlement will be explained in detail on June 2 . Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov announced earlier that the second round of the Istanbul talks with Ukraine was set for June 2. Medinsky said that he has seen reports about Ukraine's terms that may be included into its memorandum .

title: Kiev agrees on phased lifting of anti-Russian sanctions — media
summary: The second round of Russian-Ukrainian talks is expected to be held in Istanbul on June 2 . Ukraine has agreed on a phased lifting of the anti-Russian sanctions .

title: 55 people receiving in-patient treatment after railway incident in Bryansk Region
summary: Fifty-five people are receiving treatment in hospitals after the bridge collapse in the Bryansk Region . Four of them, including a child, are in serious condition, an aide to the Russian health minister said . A passenger train running from Klimov to Moscow derailed on the Pilshino-Vygonichi railway sector .

title: Palestinians clash with Israeli soldiers after protest against Pence visit - Xinhua
summary: Palestinian protesters hurl stones at Israeli soldiers during clashes after a protest against the visit of U.S. Vice President Mike Pence in Jerusalem .

title: U.S. failure to appoint Australian ambassador "diplomatic insult": former deputy PM - Xinhua
summary: Former Australian Deputy Prime Minister Tim Fischer has accused the U.S. of hitting Australia with a "diplomatic insult" Fischer served as Deputy PM from 1996 to 1999 under Australia's longest-serving Prime Minister John Howard . He said the failure to appoint an ambassador to Canberra for 18 months indicated Australia was now of "low priority"  U.S. inistration's failure to appoint an ambassador is 'extremely serious', says Simon Jackman . It has long been speculated that Admiral Harry Harris is the likely next ambassador .

title: Speaker of Hungarian Parliament addresses in Budapest - Xinhua
summary: Laszlo Kover speaks at a conference of the parliament speakers of the Western Balkans in Budapest, Hungary on Oct. 27, 2017 . Kover is the Speaker of the Hungarian Parliament .

title: Satellite lofted for first Arab country
summary: A Chinese-made communications satellite became the first "export" of such a spacecraft to an Arab country . President Xi Jinping and his Algerian counterpart Abdelaziz Bouteflika exchanged congratulatory messages on Monday morning . Xi Jinping said China is willing to work with Algeria to strengthen exchanges and cooperation in various fields .

title: Satellite lofted for first Arab country
summary: A Chinese-made communications satellite became the first "export" of such a spacecraft to an Arab country . President Xi Jinping and his Algerian counterpart Abdelaziz Bouteflika exchanged congratulatory messages on Monday morning . Xi Jinping said China is willing to work with Algeria to strengthen exchanges and cooperation in various fields .

title: WWII memorials solemn reminders of war tragedy
summary: Dec 13 marks the National Memorial Day for Nanjing Massacre Victims, which is established to commemorate the 300,000 Chinese people killed by Japanese troops after the fall of Nanjing in World War II .

title: Africa: Côte d'Ivoire Launches West Africa's First Agricultural Commodities Exchange
summary: Côte d'Ivoire has launched West Africa's first agricultural commodities exchange . The BMPA aims to bring transparency, structure, and improved income to the region's agricultural producers . 89 tonnes of goods were traded in just ten minutes, valued at nearly 31 million CFA francs .

title: Zimbabwe: Zim Defies COMESA Agreement With Controversial Surtax On Cement Imports
summary: A local cement importer, Augutich Investments (Private) Limited has approached the High Court seeking an interdict against the Minister of Finance and Economic Development over the recently introduced surtax . The importer claims the surtax contradicts the COMESA agreement, which exempts member states from paying duties on goods imported from other member states . Court papers reveal that the company has 50 haulage trucks stuck at the Chirundu border post, incurring demurrage charges of $10,000 per day .

title: Africa: It Takes a Village to End Malaria - - and Behavioural Science Can Guide It
summary: The 78th World Health Assembly took place in Geneva, Switzerland, from 19 to 27 May . The event takes place at a crucial time in global health, when shortfalls in funding threaten to undo gains made . Malaria Consortium is harnessing behavioural science to address the psychological and social factors that influence decision-making .

title: Iran warns of retaliation if Europeans 'exploit' UN nuclear report
summary: UN report shows Iran has stepped up production of highly enriched uranium . Iran's total amount of enriched uranium now exceeds 45 times the limit authorised by a landmark 2015 agreement with world powers . The European trio have warned they could reimpose sanctions if they deemed Iran's nuclear programme a threat to European security .

title: Bangladesh’s Supreme Court restores Jamaat-e-Islami's party registration
summary: Bangladesh's Supreme Court orders rightwing Jamaat-e-Islami's party registration to be restored . The ruling clears the way for the party's participation in future elections . The EC scrapped the registration of the party in December 2018 in line with a High Court ruling .

title: Myanmar junta extends ceasefire again after quake
summary: A post-earthquake ceasefire in Myanmar has been extended until June 30 . It was declared after a huge earthquake killed nearly 3,800 people and left tens of thousands homeless . The junta has been accused of flouting the ceasefire with regular air strikes .

title: 'Our most long-range operation': Ukrainian President Zelenskyy hails ‘brilliant’ drone strikes on Russia
summary: The operation targeted several Russian military airfields, destroying more than 40 aircraft, including bombers and surveillance planes . It marked what Ukraine's Security Service called the most extensive strike yet on Russian soil, carried out entirely by Ukrainian forces . 41 Russian planes, including strategic Tupolev Tu-95 and Tu-22M bombers, reportedly destroyed .

title: 'Putin is a thug': US senators say he’s stalling peace with Ukraine, planning new offensive
summary: Republican Senator Lindsey Graham and Democrat Senator Richard Blumenthal said the coming two weeks could be crucial in shaping the future of a war that has devastated cities, displaced millions, and reshaped Europe’s security landscape . The senators met Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and visited areas devastated by the worst Russian bombardments since the full-scale invasion began . The bill would impose crippling tariffs of 500% on countries continuing to import Russian oil, gas, uranium, and other key exports .

title: Over 2,69,000 blocked from entering Mecca without permit ahead of Hajj, say Saudi officials
summary: Clampdown aims to reduce overcrowding and prevent repeat of last year's heat-related tragedies . Authorities have imposed fines of up to $5,000 on violators, including Saudi citizens and residents . The Hajj, one of Islam's five pillars, is expected to draw over 1.4 million people to Mecca in the coming days .

title: Lifting of Israeli blockade ‘the only way to avert mass starvation’ in Gaza: UNRWA chief
summary: Philippe Lazzarini posted on social media saying aid distribution “has become a death trap” citing reports from international medical staff on the ground and local health authorities who reported at least 31 deaths and more than 150 injured as civilians were lining up to receive aid . The IDF has strongly denied that civilians were fired on, accusing Hamas militants of misinformation . Medical staff at Nasser hospital in nearby Khan Younis told media outlets that around 79 people were admitted with gunshot wounds .

title: Helpless in the face of hunger: Gaza families pray for deliverance – or death
summary: Gaza's beach has become a last refuge for Palestinians displaced by Israeli bombardment and military operations . The strip of coast around Gaza's seaport has turned into a makeshift camp . Thousands of tents and overcrowded conditions reflect the gravity of a humanitarian crisis .

title: As AI evolves, pressure mounts to regulate ‘killer robots’
summary: UN and non-governmental organisations are calling for international regulation of Lethal Autonomous Weapons (LAWS) to avoid a near-future where machines dictate life-and-death choices . The Ukrainian army is also heavily reliant on drones and is reportedly developing a ‘drone wall’ – a defensive line of armed Unmanned Aerial Vehicles – to protect vulnerable sections of the country’s frontiers . UN-appointed human rights investigation has concluded that these attacks constitute crimes against humanity .

title: The Futile Quest to Build a “Liberal Joe Rogan”
summary: Democratic operatives have a $20 million plan to build a "Joe Rogan of the left" The plan was immediately panned online by critics who argued that young men would view this type of approach as inauthentic . An analysis of 320 of the most popular online shows across platforms such as Youtube, Rumble, and TikTok found that right-leaning shows were significantly more popular, accounting for roughly 82% percent of the total following of online shows . Experts say investing millions to recreate a “Joe Rogan of the left” fundamentally misunderstands why young men moved so rapidly to the right .

title: How Student Protesters and Immigrants Became Targets of Trump’s Surveillance Tech
summary: New York Focus investigates how surveillance technology is being weaponized to silence dissent on American campuses and fuel the deportations of immigrants . A new one-strike visa cancellation policy will be used for visa interviews with foreign students . The effort is powered by more companies than most people realize .

title: Marco Rubio Is Attacking American Education. International Students Are His Pawns.
summary: Marco Rubio is weaponizing his legal purview, under the guise of foreign policy, to crush dissent and target international students . Rubio announced in a gnomic statement that the Trump administration will “aggressively revoke” visas of Chinese students, including those with “ties to the Chinese Communist Party”  Rubio also ordered a halt to all new interview appointments for international students applying for student visas . In the last academic year, the U.S. hosted over 1.1 million international students, nearly two-thirds of whom were Chinese or Indian .
